fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9014].
  {panel}

I am currently evaluating Jira and it is the last point to confirm if our company will purchase it....  I would like the permission model supports "Reporter's Group".  See the following examples will explain the reason why it is very helpful:

1) We have several products, e.g Product1, Product2 ....
     Each product has its own component, version & release note
2) We support several dealers worldwide, e.g. Dealer1, Dealer2, ....
    Each dealer is a "User Group" associating with a set of logins
4) We have a central support team for all dealers
5) However, it is critical that dealer should see ONLY his issues but not other dealers' issues

So, I will setup project like
   Product 1 Support Area    (with all component, version, release note setup properly)
   Product 2 Support Area
   ....
   However, the above cannot be achieved because there is no "Reporter's Group" permission for viewing the project 

Because of the limitation, I need to create many project like:
    Product 1 Support Area for Dealer 1
    Product 1 Support Area for Dealer 2
    ....
    Product 2 Support Area for Dealer 1
    Product 2 Support Area for Dealer 2
    ....

And I need to duplicate all component, version & release note info into many projects.  Also, the issue finder will be more difficult to use.

In fact, most IT companies have the similar workflow that they have several products & dealers .... but because of the sensivity of sales issues (some business deals cannot be seen by other dealers), all issues should be private to dealer group only.  I wish Jira will support this.  Many many thks.
fields.summary: Add "Reporter Group" Permission

fields.description:
A customer wants to permit browse/view permissions to all employees of a particular customer company so their customer can view issues created by themselves and issues created by their fellow colleagues.

Users who belong to Customer A group, can view issues created by _any_ user in Customer A.
fields.summary: Allow customer X users to view all issues created by any user in customer X

fields.description:
The version workload report currently displays all issue types within the report - even if the project is associated with an issue type scheme limiting the issue types available.

The report should only show the available issue types if associated with a scheme (for Pro and Ent editions).
fields.summary: Version Workload Report should adhere to issue type scheme if defined for specified project.

fields.description:
1. Navigate to dashboard
2. Make sure there's at least one 'project statistics' portlet
3. Click 'configure on'
4. Click the 'project statistics' link for any portlet

Java NumberFormatException fires (see attachment).
fields.summary: Clicking 'project statistics' for a portlet on the dashboard causes Java NumberFormatException

fields.description: Custom string fields should have a virtually unlimited length (eg: 4000 characters). We ran into problems where we had a custom field which contained a url, but a user was not able to add data if it were over 255 characters because the db would complain about truncating. Expanding the field solved the problem. (How we just get a warning when the product starts up)
fields.summary: Increase the length of the column 'StringValue' in the table 'CustomFieldValue' from 255 characters

fields.description:
I cloned an issue that was fixed in an earlier (archived) release because it was easier than creating one from scratch.
But then the new issue got flagged as having been fixed in archived versions, and the only way to untag them would be to unarchive the versions for the project. Cloning an issue should not copy this information.
fields.summary: Cloning an issue copies fix versions for archived versions

Now you are in the "Filter View" screen, underwich it states "You are currently using a new, unsaved search". In reality you are using a PRESET FILTER, it would be nice if this was stated, along with the filter name, on this page.

fields.description: As we are so used to using Alt-N and Alt-P to navigate an issue result list, having a shortcut for Return to Search would also be helpful. Since so many issues are wider than the screen width, using the shortcuts avoids a lot of scrolling, but the Return to Search is not available. Would you be able to find a shortcut key that might be available for all browsers?
fields.summary: Add keyboard shortcut for "Return to Search"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8998].
  {panel}

I would like the ability to create a listing of an adhoc set of issues.  One thing that I thought could be useful in facilitating this would be the addition of tags to an issue.

Similar to how Amazon lets you tag any products with a label that is meaningful to you, or how flickr.com and http://del.icio.us let you tag photos  and bookmarks.

Once I have the ability to tag issues, I should then be able to easily get a listing of all the issues with that tag.

One thing that I would use this functionality for now is to be able to tag issues that were reviewed (or should be reviewed) in a meeting.  I'd apply the same tag to all of them and then run my filter and publish the results.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to add tags to issues and then create filters based on the tags

fields.description: I login to the Atlassian support center and I see the bulk-change link.  I did not try to click it but I should not see it at all, methinks...  Is this secured?  It should be.
fields.summary: Why do I see the bulk-change capability when working with the Atlassian JIRA bug tracker?

fields.description: We don't want time tracking to be global.  We want it on for some projects and off for others. There is no such granularity evident.
fields.summary: Make Time Tracking  A Project-Specific Feature

fields.description: "All Projects" is not translated to german, when using german locale
fields.summary: "All Projects" not translated to german on "Find Issue" page

fields.description:
Hi,

I'd like to make 2 changes in our 3.0.2 JIRA:

Rename 'Priority' field to 'Severity''
Create a new 'Priority' field with three selectable options; High, Medium and Low

What do I have to do? Your help would be appreciated.


Thanks,

Christian
fields.summary: Renaming 'Priority' to 'Severity' and Creating a New 'Priority' Field

fields.description:
Modify the RunSearchRequest Jelly tag [1] so it can take in a filter id that will be used as the search request.

[1] The tag currently only accepts a single custom field id and value which isn't exactly usable
fields.summary: Improve the RunSearchRequest Jelly tag so it supports a filter id.
Link directly to user profile in comments

fields.description: Mantis 0.17 and earlier didn't store users' full names, just the username. In Mantis 0.18 this was fixed with the 'realname' column. JIRA's Mantis importer needs to be updated to use 'realname'.
fields.summary: Mantis importer does not import user's full names
The JIRA Updater no longer works (and currently fails in windows)

fields.description: I've had a bunch of requests from our users here to be able to define the default sort order for Comments. Sometimes the Comments/History are shown in Ascending order and other times in Descending order. How is this order determiend and how can we set this to a preference? Ideally, the default should be the latest comments on the top of the list.
fields.summary: Setting the default sort order when viewing Comments/History

fields.description:
I have some custom fields of type "Select List" that I need to convert to fields of type "Multi Select", without loosing their current values.
How can I accomplish this?
fields.summary: Convert Select List to Multi Select

fields.description:
To reproduce:

1. Add the 'Update Issue Field' post function to the create issue transition within a workflow. Set the assignee to be a specific user.
2. Move the post function to be executed after the issue has been created within the post function execution order.

Once an issue is created through this workflow, the issue appears with the incorrect assignee within the 'View Issue' screen.
However, the issue is displayed with the correct assignee within the issue navigator. Re-indexing does not resolve this issue.
fields.summary: 'Update Issue Field' post function on assignee field results in inconsistent results when added to 'Create Issue' transition.
Restrict cookie-based login to SSL users

fields.description:
The idea is to have a single RSS feed which users can subscribe to, which could contain events for changes made in a project in the recent past. The type of events (comments, worklog entries, issue created events) would need to be configurable. One should also be able to define the RSS in terms of a search-derived issue list, rather than a hardcoded project.

See this thread:

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257222381&#257222381
fields.summary: RSS of Project Changes

fields.description:
The Sections column on the left of the Notation Guide changes width when you select different sections.
e.g if I have Links selected, the menu looks like

ALL
Text
Formatting
Headings
Text Breaks
*Links*
Lists
Images
Attachments
Tables
Advanced
Formatting
Misc

If I have Text Formatting selected, it looks like:


ALL
*Text Formatting*
Headings
Text Breaks
Links
Lists
Images
Attachments
Tables
Advanced
Formatting
Misc

The fact that "Text Formatting" gets split over 2 lines makes everything else move down, meaning that it is difficult to navigate quickly through the sections (e.g. if you don't know exactly where the thing you are looking for is located).

This isn't a major problem but would be very easy to fix. I have only marked the versions that I have tested it on (mine is 3.4.2, yours is 3.4.3E).
fields.summary: Make 'Sections' menu in Text Formatting Notation Help constant width

fields.description:
At the moment the Generic Event notification (and hence the e-mail that is sent out) is used only in Workflow Transitions. The e-mail notification should contain the status change as it is unclear what happened to the issue.

Need to ensure that the html and text templates are updated.
fields.summary: Add Status to the Generic Event template
Consider adding a SOAP service to get all users

fields.description:
At the moment each table of the Version Workload report does not have a total for each issue type and the overall total.

The total needs to be added at the bottom of each report table.
fields.summary: Add totals row for Version Workload report

fields.description: When you call the getIssue remote service the assignee and reporter names in the RemoteIssue are full namesIn contrast, the createIssue service requires you to populate the RemoteIssue with userids (as the full name is not unique).  Would it be possible to make these two services consistent?  Remote clients can always look up the full username from the ID.
fields.summary: SOAP service getIssue returns full usernames instead of user ids

fields.description:
Bugzilla and Mantis have more fine-grained options for things like statuses, resolutions and priorities. JIRA's importer is hardcoded for the JIRA defaults, which aren't as fine-grained, so some information is lost during the import.

Eg. RESOLVED and VERIFIED Bugzilla issues both become 'Resolved' in JIRA, and issues with 'Major' and 'Normal' priorities both get priority 'Major'.
fields.summary: Bugzilla and Mantis importers lose information (hardcoded statuses, resolutions, priorities)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8966].
  {panel}

There are a few general configuration properties that influence the operations and values that are allowable when calling the remote interface.  Examples of such properties are:
* Allow users to vote on issues
* Allow users to watch issues
* Allow unassigned issues

I need to know the value of these properties to correctly show/hide various actions.

A service that returned name/value pairs would be sufficient.
fields.summary: SOAP service to list general configuration properties

fields.description:
I imported many projects from our old system via CVS. But I got the date translations incorrect. I'd like to be able to directly edit the DB and change the created date on each to the date I imported them. (currenlty some of the dates are way off in the future). This will be much faster than reimporting all the projects. 

Can you give me the info I need on where in the DB the created date field is stored for each issue?
fields.summary: Change dates of issue directly in data base

fields.description:
I changed the "default order of actions"  in file "jira-application.properties"     from asc to dsc

This has changed the down-arrow to an up-arrow, as expected, on the issue display of comments and change log.  However,  the actual sort order does not change and remains oldest to newest.  

Changing the order through the web interface changes the order correctly but the default does not work.

Is there another parameter that I have missed that needs changing?
IS the web display reading the flag correctly but the search retrieval ignoring the flag?

This seems to have some relationship to  JRA-3454  and JRA-5385 but unless I missed something there is no reference to another parameter that needs setting.
fields.summary: Default Sort Order for Comments does not work as expected

  {panel}

Is it possible to expand the FIND ISSUES screen with something like the following option?:
"Has been assigned to"

It will help us to report on which persons have been working on an issue

At this moment we "only"have the following options:
"Reporter",
"Assignee"
fields.summary: expanding Find Issue  screen filtering (2)

fields.description:
Is it possible to expand the  FIND ISSUES screen with the following options:

  "Closed After",
  "Closed Before"
  "Closed: From / To"

It will help us to make a filter for our SLA-reports

At this moment we "only"have the following options:
  "Created After",
  "Created Before"
  "Created: From / To"
  "Updated After",
  "Updated Before"
  "Updated: From / To"
  "Due After",
  "Due Before"
  "Due Date : From / To"





.
fields.summary: expanding FIND ISSUE screen (filtering)

fields.description: see tooltip of this link JRA-4935. Its probably  a symptom of double encoding (encoding a already encoded String) which i recently trapped in too.(TextUtils.plainTextToHtml or somethin you are using)
fields.summary: Link titles of Jira shortcut links are not correctly encoded

fields.description:
When running JIRA's unit tests (and maybe functional tests), the tests compare date formats. The comparison depends on the locale. For example if the locate is ja_JP the test will fail.

This can affect people building JIRA from the source distribution.
fields.summary: Ensure JIRA unit (and functional tests?) pass on machines with locate set to other than en_* e.g. en_US or en_AU

fields.description: Create an upgrade guide for the issue JRA-8352 about services populated with null names
fields.summary: Create upgrade guide for services with null names
Add totals for issue types (across all developers) to the Version Workload report

fields.description: Adding "Current Assignee" to the Browse permission for a project lets any user of the system see that project (they can't necessarily view issues or create issues, but they can see the project).
fields.summary: "Current Assignee" on Browse Permission creates security hole

This way I could search for issues reported by Keith to find my issues, and maybe some by other people named Keith.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8943].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 24 August 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

We're pleased to announce that the new rich text editor will be available in the upcoming release of JIRA Server 7.2.

We are still working on providing a great, modern text editor for JIRA Cloud with a consistent user interface across all of Atlassian Cloud, including Confluence Cloud, Bitbucket Cloud, and HipChat. We will continue to provide updates on this issue when we are farther along on bringing the new text editor to JIRA Cloud.

If you're a JIRA Cloud user looking for an alternative in the meantime, consider checking out the [Simple Edit (WYSIWYG)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/simple-edit] add-on in the Atlassian Marketplace

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions or feedback.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

*Original request description*
 
Now that JIRA supports wiki markup, it would be nice if there is a WYSIWYG/Rich Text editor for JIRA (similar to the one in Confluence).
fields.summary: WYSIWYG / Rich Text Editor

fields.description: Try creating a "Visible to" multi-user picker custom field, and allow only this custom field's users to "Browse" issues in the permission scheme. One can no longer view issues in affected projects, even if you are in the "Visible to" custom field for some issues.
fields.summary: Granting User Custom Field "Browse" permission has no effect

fields.description:
To replicate:

# Create a "Visible to:" multi-user picker custom field
# Create an issue-level security scheme
# Create a security level, and add the "Visible to" custom field as a member to that level
# Set a project to use the security scheme and level
# Create an issue, and add your own username to the "Visible to" field

The issue will be visible to you (and no-one else) when accessed directly. However when searching, this issue will not show up for you.
fields.summary: User Picker custom field used in Security Level makes issues invisible to searchers

fields.description:
I'm trying to upgrade our JIRA to the current version, and am running into issues with the database. Our database has not been properly through an xml export + new database + import type upgrade since JIRA 2.6, and so it has no indexes or primary keys in it.

Somehow or other, our database has some duplicates in the "ID" column of the OS_CURRENTSTEP table, which becomes a primary key in the 3.4 database; the export works without a complaint, but the import process balks at the duplicate keys. I'm not sure what all is related to the IDs in that table, and need to know what I can do to fix it. The integrity checker does not notice it.
fields.summary: Upgrade - duplicate keys in OS_CURRENTSTEP

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8938].
  {panel}

We would like to exclude Versions from the current dashboard issue counts.

For example if I have these versions in my project FOO.

F1-M1
F1-M2
F1-M3
F1-RC
F2-M1

I'd like to be able to exclude "F2-M1" since that is a future version that we are not working on yet, and that we are postponing issue to.  This skews our dashboard numbers for our current drive to zero issues.
fields.summary: Allow Limiting by Version for Browser Project Open Issues Dashboard

fields.description: Where can I find a documentation about the list of available objects (in the Velocity context) for email templates?
fields.summary: List of available objects in the Velocity context for Email template

fields.description: It seems that I am able to close off the parent issue without resolving/closing the sub tasks. I was under the impression that you can't do this if a sub task is still alive which is what we want. Some of the atlassian forum posts and issues suggested this behaviour but the documentation at http://atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/subtasks.html doesn't mention what is the expected behaviour. This might just be a permissions thing but I haven't seen or read anything about permissions for subtasks apart from you'll need the create permission in the project the parent is in before you can create a sub task. Can someone clarify if this is possible?
fields.summary: closing parent issue when sub task is unresolved

fields.description: When switching to a foreign locale, the View Preferences and Edit Preferences pages show an English window title, whereas most (or all) of the other pages I visited had their titles match the foreign language display.
fields.summary: Window title stays in English on some pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8934].
  {panel}

I archived an older version of the project since it was released a while ago and no further development was going against it.
Then, I re-opened a resolved issue that had been previously set as 'Fix For' that version. I didn't visit the Fix version field on my additional info screen so I didn't notice what it said, but presumably, it wouldn't have shown the older version in the dropdown because, being archived, it won't show that version anymore.
So, after re-opening the issue, i ended up with an issue scheduled to be fixed for a very old version.
The app should warn me if re-opening an issue for an archived version.
fields.summary: Re-opening issue against archived version doesn't prompt user for new version

fields.description: I put an image sql.gif into the images/icons/attachments folder. How do I get JIRA to use that icon when displaying SQL files as attachments?
fields.summary: How to change attachment icon?

fields.description:
I was wondering if it is at all possible to have a unique set of Issue Types for a single project.  For some reason I was under the impression that I could do it with this latest version of JIRA.

And if it is possible I would greatly appreciate it if you could please point me in the right direction on how this can be done.

Thanks.
fields.summary: A question about the possibility of having unique Issue Types per project

fields.description: The "Configure your Issue Navigator" in column-view has a link on "Configure" for the action itself.   In the portuguese language pack, there is an error in the template, in which the statement is translated correctly but there is no link to the action on the word "Configurar".
fields.summary: Non-existing "configuration issue navigator" link in brazilian portugues language

fields.description:
Associating a workflow scheme to a project is not informative without issues. You are asked twice to do the same association. Steps to reproduce:

-At project administration view
-click "select" from "Workflow Scheme:  None ( select  ) "
-At Associate Scheme to Project
-click Associate
-At Associate Workflow Scheme to Project: [project name] There are no issues to migrate.
-click Associate
fields.summary: Associating a workflow scheme to a project is not informative without issues

fields.description:
I have created a workflowscheme W1 and a copy of it W2 (W1=W2)
I import a project and i set the workflow scheme to W1 using this:
.
.
ComponentManager.getInstance().getWorkflowSchemeManager().addSchemeToProject(project, workflowScheme);

Then I import the Issues. Everything seems to go fine. 
In Jira I can open the project and Workflow Scheme will be set to W1.
But if I open an issue I will not have any Available Workflow Actions 

If I then open the Project info again and put the workflow to W2. everything works fine.
Is there an error or am I missing a step?
fields.summary: a workflowscheme will not be properly set to an imported project

fields.description:
This can be an extension to the AccessLogFilter that we have in JIRA already. I guess whether to dump headers can be passed as a parameter.

At the moment tomcat has the:
<Valve className="org.apache.catalina.valves.RequestDumperValve"/>
and other app servers might have something similar,  but it would be nice to be able to turn this on in JIRA without restarting and on all app servers.
fields.summary: Create a filter that would dump the request response headers to a log file

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8926].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

This suggestion is a priority for the JIRA development team. We are planning on making modifications to default issue type schemes in JIRA 7.0 which will support the functionality described in this issue. We will update this issue as soon as we can confidently project a release.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]

Guillaume

The Excel All report still splits Description across multiple rows in 3.4.2.  This appeared to be fixed in 3.3.1 with one of the linked tickets.  This makes things very difficult, since users want to dump and sort all fields, not customize their navigator and use Current.  As a temporary workaround, would you post a file which could replace the proper velocity template with one that ignores description field until this is fixed?

Jeff

fields.description:
Permission Scheme will not be set to Jiras default permission scheme when importing a project via jelly tags.
If I run the Jelly:

<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
<jira:CreateProject key="CHI" name="Chiver AD" lead="admin">
</jira:CreateProject>
</JiraJelly>

The default permission scheme will not be set even though it's default.
I have many projects to add and it would take a lot of time to go through them all by hand.
Is there a way to force jira to set the default permission scheme?
fields.summary: Permission Scheme will not be set to default permission when importing project via jelly tags

fields.description:
"Available workflow actions" could be replaced with "Workflow transitions". This would be an improvement because:
 - "Available" is redundant (why not "Available Operations" too?) and just adds visual clutter.
 - "actions" is an OSWorkflow term. Everywhere else we use "transition", which is much clearer, so for consistency we should use it here too.

fields.description:
We're using the timesheet reporting plugin, which I realise is a third party product, and not supported by you guys, but it seems to expose some problems.  http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/Timesheet+report+and+portlet

For instance, we have issue level security turned on, but a non-privileged user can run a pivot report and see all the titles and worklogs of issues that they can't normally see.  Clicking on the link for more details correctly results in a "permission denied" message from jira, but my feeling is that they shouldn't be seen at all.

That's the most important issue for us.  Next up would be that we really don't want these unprivileged users seeing time reports at all.  I guess that's an issue for a more general permissions issue.

Cheers,
Karl P
fields.summary: Plugins can see issues that the user running the issue should be able to

fields.description:
Perhaps I'm just not understanding the database structure properly, but it seems the vote listings for issue does not reflect what is in the database.

Eg:

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewVoters!default.jspa?id=23862 

Here there are 15 voters listed:

Ahmet Goral   (agoral)
Alexander Chernodub (noir_ep)
Amitee Robinson (amitee)
Axel Stollfuss (astoll)
Elaine Green (ug67erg)
Fernando J. Martínez Pérez (nando)
Josh Polette (jpolette)
Joshua Standing (jstanding)
Karl-Koenig Koenigsson (koenig)
Kevin James (jamezzz)
Miro Lehky (mlehky)
Omid Fatehi (ofatehi)
Pearl, Shelby (sepearl)
Sebastian Salgado (ssalgado)
Sergio Castillo (slcastillo)

However a query of the database returns only 13:

atlassian-jira=# select * from userassociation where association_type='VoteIssue' and sink_node_entity='Issue' and  sink_node_id=23862;
 source_name | sink_node_id | sink_node_entity | association_type | sequence 
-------------+--------------+------------------+------------------+----------
 slcastillo  |        23862 | Issue            | VoteIssue        |         
 jstanding   |        23862 | Issue            | VoteIssue        |         
 astoll      |        23862 | Issue            | VoteIssue        |         
 mlehky      |        23862 | Issue            | VoteIssue        |         
 ofatehi     |        23862 | Issue            | VoteIssue        |         
 amitee      |        23862 | Issue            | VoteIssue        |         
 nando       |        23862 | Issue            | VoteIssue        |         
 noir_ep     |        23862 | Issue            | VoteIssue        |         
 koenig      |        23862 | Issue            | VoteIssue        |         
 sepearl     |        23862 | Issue            | VoteIssue        |         
 ug67erg     |        23862 | Issue            | VoteIssue        |         
 agoral      |        23862 | Issue            | VoteIssue        |         
 jpolette    |        23862 | Issue            | VoteIssue        |         
(13 rows)

The missing two users are 'jamezzz' and 'ssalgado'.

Other more extreme examples can be found, eg. http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewVoters!default.jspa?id=24754 returns 48 votes, but the SQL query returns only 23.

The code for retrieving the voter list is:

{code}
associationManager.getUserFromSink(issue, "VoteIssue", false)
{code}

which seems to correspond to this SQL query. Either something is badly wrong with JIRA's votes or I've got the SQL incorrect.

add "Shortcut Links" like Confluence has to JIRA

fields.description: If one customizes their installation of JIRA (and we have), then the help ones receives from the yellow help baloons is now inappropriate. It goes back to the atlassian website. As an enhancement, it would be great to include in the distribution a 'docs' directory that contains everything that is available online at http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/ This way, it could be customized for each install, and instead of confusing users with issue types and priorities that aren't there anymore (or are missing some!), we'd have appropriate values. Same goes for 'versions' and 'components'. Instead of describing generically what they are, we could list our actual components, and for the non-intuitive, describe why it's appropriate to log HTML bugs as type: bug, priority: trivial, and component: user-interface. Forward thinking.. it would be handy if these were JSP pages, so that the pages would update themselves. (it would pull the icon and description from the db, as the admin pages do currently). What we will probably end up doing is combing the pages for any
fields.summary: CLONE -'Get Online Help' icons not helpful in a customized install.

fields.description:
The "transitions" listed in JIRA's workflow editor are actually OSWorkflow "actions". Using the same term as OSWorkflow's documentation and XML DTD would cut down on confusion.
In fact, the term "action" is used when viewing an issue. (You get a list of "Avialable Workflow Actions"). Thus, it would also cut down on confusion within JIRA itself.
fields.summary: Change term "transition" to "action" in workflow editor

fields.description:

Similar to the listing of the IDs of the steps and "transitions" when viewing a workflow.

This will assist in writing workflows in XML.

fields.description:
I added a custom field that is configured for one project and a subset of the available issue types.  

I attempted to add this custom field as a comment in the issue navigator using Issue Navigator > Configure.  The field shows up in the "add columns" selection and when I add it, it shows up in the designer tool.  I can move the column to where I want it.  But when I view the issue navigator (i.e. not in configure mode) the column is not there.  I changed the assignment of the custom field to "all issue types" and the problem went away.  This bug appears similar to 5933 but not exactly the same. 

A possibly related problem is that the custom field does not show up as a filter choice in the Filter>New or Filter>Edit screens.  When I change the application of the custom field to "all issue types" then it does show up in the filter construction screens.  The custom field is a radio button field and it is configured to have radio button search.
fields.summary: custom field appears in issue navigator configuration but not in issue navigator

fields.description: We've created a custom field called "Elements Affected" which is a free-text field of unlimited length.  When the issues are exported to Excel, only the first 80 characters of this field are included.   This is a critical problem for us in that this field has several hundred characters in it and we need to export this field to Excel on a routine basis.
fields.summary: When issues are exported to Excel, only the first 80 characters of a custom field are exported

fields.description:
If the Issue Navigator list contains several pages of issues, and you happen to be positioned anywhere other than the first page, when you export to Excel it only exports a partial list of the issues - from the page you're on and beyond.  So, for example, if there are 4 pages of issues and you're sitting on page 3, the Excel file will only contain the issues that appear on pages 3 and 4 within Issue Navigator.  

Export to Excel should always give you the complete list, even if you're on page 3 of 4.
fields.summary: Export to Excel doesn't export all records unless you are on Page 1

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8898].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; unfortunately we don't have any plans to support this in JIRA for the foreseeable future.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

The Original Estimate field, which in JIRA is displayed as 1 day, 2 days, 2 weeks, etc. is converted to seconds per 7-hour day when it reaches Excel.  For example, a task that is 1 day in JIRA appears as 25200 in Excel.

I see a bug where this was done in order to implement sorting of time, but is there a way to switch this back to preserve the original date formatting - we don't need to sort by second and we would like to not have to manually reconvert back to dates.
fields.summary: Original Estimate field's Excel export format should be configurable

fields.description:
In recent JIRA versions, it's possible to have a (multi) user picker custom field, and specify in the notification scheme, specify that those users get certain notifications (ie like a 'Cc' field).

It would be a small extension of this to allow a *group* to be associated with an issue, and notify the group members of changes.

The same thing applies to permission schemes.
fields.summary: Notify members of a group custom field of changes
Scheme inheritance: define schemes in terms of other schemes, to factor out commonalities

fields.description: When bulk moving issues to a new project, 'Retain' has no effect when used with versions.  Even if both old and new projects have a '1.0' version, issue versions are lost in the transfer.
